inclusion.criterion: Clinically significant mitral regurgitation of primarily functional pathology
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) ≥20% determined by echocardiography
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: High surgical risk as determined by Heart Team consensus
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Documented New York Heart Association Class II to Class IV heart failure, despite optimal standard of care therapy
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Written informed consent in accordance with Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and local legislation
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Echocardiographic evaluation not available or not suitable for analysis at baseline
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Severe tricuspid regurgitation according to current guidelines
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Other severe valve disorders requiring intervention according to current guidelines
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Coronary revascularization or cardiac resynchronization (CRT) device implantation within 1 month before the procedure
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patient not amenable for mitral valve surgery/ percutaneous mitral valve reconstruction as judged by Heart Team
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: 34 year old woman with Marfan's syndrome and known severe mitral valve prolapse with regurgitation, who was planned for a MV repair but was lost to follow-up. She remains symptomatic and is now prepared to undergo mitral valve repair/replacement surgery.
